00001 // Statistical error matrix calculator assuming Gaussian pull distributions
00002 // for rho and theta, using the output of getPdfInfo.cc
00003 
00004 #ifndef ERRMATSTATGAUSS
00005 #define ERRMATSTATGAUSS
00006 
00007 #include "BToDKTo3piK/Poly3.hh"
00008 #include "BToDKTo3piK/ErrMat.hh"
00009 
00010 class ErrMatStatGauss : public ErrMat {
00011 public: 
00012   enum Charge {MINUS=0, PLUS=1, NCHARGES = 2};
00013   
00014   ErrMatStatGauss();
00015 
00016   ErrMatStatGauss(const Poly3 & rhoErr,
00017                   const Poly3 & thetaErr,
00018                   const Poly3 & rhoErrSpread,
00019                   const Poly3 & thetaErrSpread,
00020                   const Poly3 & rhoPullSigma,
00021                   const Poly3 & thetaPullSigma,
00022                   double rhoErrNSpreads[NCHARGES],
00023                   double thetaErrNSpread[NCHARGES]);
00024   
00025   virtual ~ErrMatStatGauss();

00028             const Poly3 & thetaErr,
00029             const Poly3 & rhoErrSpread,
00030             const Poly3 & thetaErrSpread,
00031             const Poly3 & rhoPullSigma,
00032             const Poly3 & thetaPullSigma,
00033             double rhoErrNSpreads[NCHARGES],
00034             double thetaErrNSpread[NCHARGES]);
00035   
00036   
00037   double measuredErrRho(double rho, Charge c) const;
00038   double measuredErrTheta(double rho, Charge c) const;
00039 
00040   TMatrixD matrix(double rM, double tM, double rP, double tP) const;
00041 
00042 
00043 private:
00044   // 4th-order polynomial parameters for rho and theta error vs. true rho,
00045   // one for theta- and rho- and one for theta+ and rho+:
00046   Poly3 _rhoErr;
00047   Poly3 _thetaErr;
00048   
00049   // Parameters for the spread of the rho and theta error vs. true rho:
00050   Poly3 _rhoErrSpread;
00051   Poly3 _thetaErrSpread;
00052   
00053   // Parameters for the spread of the rho and theta pulls vs. true rho:
00054   Poly3 _rhoPullSigma;
00055   Poly3 _thetaPullSigma;
00056   
00057   // The number of spreads away from the average error we want to be.
00058   // This is generally chosen so as to match the data fluctuation
00059   // wrt. the average error for a given true rho:
00060   double _rhoErrNSpreads[NCHARGES];
00061   double _thetaErrNSpreads[NCHARGES];
00062

00065 #endif
